channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple Warns iPhone AI Features Delayed For Millions Of Users To 2025
item.description: For the new Apple Intelligence capabilities coming to the iPhone, you’ll need to be patient if you’re living in Europe, until at least next year.

item.title: The Western Union trap
item.description: When the telephone began to gain traction, the monopoly of the time, Western Union, decided to get even better at sending telegrams.

item.title: Generative AI Is Turning Memes Into Nightmares
item.description: Luma Labs Dream Machine is turning memes into uncanny nightmares, as users experiment with AI-generated video.

item.title: The near future (and summer reads)
item.description: Near-future science fiction is a fine way to consider our now. Without the reality of today, we can think hard about the tomorrow we’re about to live ...

item.title: ‘The Boys’ Viewership Up, ‘House Of The Dragon’ Viewership Down, With A Catch
item.description: Two colossal new shows have returned this month (The Bear soon, too?) in the form of The Boys season 4 on Amazon Prime Video and House of the Dragon o...

item.title: Phrenology
item.description: For thousands of years, and as recently as the 1930s, phrenology was seen as a useful proxy to judge someone’s character. Carefully charting the bumps...

item.title: Parsing The Future: The Promises And Perils Of Large Language Models
item.description: Despite their potential to drive productivity and enable new forms of human-machine collaboration, LLMs are still nascent. Amir Feizpour believes they...

item.title: Are you weather?
item.description: The thunderstorm doesn’t know we exist. Rain dances and wishes are ineffective at bringing or preventing a storm, because it isn’t caused by our actio...

item.title: These Are The Most Stressful Cities For Commuters, Data Shows
item.description: Those who think their daily drives are onerous should check out this rogues gallery of the world’s most nerve-wracking commutes

item.title: “What will I tell my boss?”
